verbose_text: Mass spectrometry analyses of Golgi bodies and ER isolated from the hippocampus showed that treating mice with amitriptyline in the presence or absence of corticosterone stress increased the concentrations of sphingomyelin in the Golgi bodies and of ceramide in the ER.
evidence: ER isolated from the hippocampus showed that treating mice with amitriptyline in the presence or absence of corticosterone stress increased the concentrations of sphingomyelin
